rsbNotes.title: Acts 27:24
rsbNotes.text: 27:24 granted you all . . . with you. In His kindness God saved everyone in the ship.

rsbNotes.title: Acts 27:26
rsbNotes.text: 27:26 some island. The island of Malta, south of Sicily.

rsbNotes.title: Acts 27:34
rsbNotes.text: 27:34 not a hair is to perish from . . . any. God is in control of the minute details of life (Luke 21:18).

rsbNotes.title: Acts 27:37
rsbNotes.text: 27:37 276 persons in the ship. This number of passengers on an ancient seagoing vessel was not unusual. Some ships of the period could carry considerably more.

rsbNotes.title: Acts 27:41
rsbNotes.text: 27:41 But striking a reef. See text note. This is the narrow channel in St. Paul’s Bay between Malta and the island of Salmonetta, where the currents create sandbars. This sort of nautical detail indicates that Luke was an eyewitness of the event.
